fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Abelian group structure on the W-bar construction

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Suppose the simplicial group G is abelian, then the W-bar construction still has an abelian group structure, by multiplication element-wise.

Given a simplicial group, we can define a model of its universal principal bundle {\mathbf{E}} G \to {\mathbf{B}} G as simplicial sets {W} G \to {\bar{W}} G. This is a generalization of the bar construction, if we consider a group G as a discrete simplicial set. It classifies principal G-bundles in the sense of Theorem 21.13 in Simplicial objects in algebraic topology.

We define the n-simplices of {W} G to be ({W} G)_n = G_0 \times G_1 \times \cdots \times G_n so that G_n acts on ({W} G)_n by taking the face map that discards the last k vertices for each k, and then acting on the appropriate factor on the right. This forces the face maps and degeneracy maps to be \begin{aligned} \partial_k (g_0, \dots, g_n) &= (g_0, \dots, g_{k-1}, \partial_k g_{k+1}, \dots, \partial_k g_n), \\ \sigma_k (g_0, \dots, g_n) &= (g_0, \dots, g_{k}, \sigma_k g_{k}, \dots, \sigma_k g_n). \end{aligned} We define {\bar{W}} G to be {W} G quotiented by the action of G. This can be represented as ({\bar{W}} G)_n = G_0 \times \cdots \times G_{n-1}, with the quotient map ({W} G)_n \twoheadrightarrow ({\bar{W}} G)_n given by (g_0, \dots, g_n) \mapsto (g_0 (\partial_1 g_1)^{-1}, \dots, g_{n-1} (\partial_n g_n)^{-1}). The face and degeneracy maps can then be computed to be \begin{aligned} \partial_k (g_0, \dots, g_{n-1}) &= (g_0, g_1, \dots, g_{k-1} \cdot \partial_k g_k, \partial_k g_{k+1}, \dots, \partial_k g_{n-1}), \\ \partial_n (g_0, \dots, g_{n-1}) &= (g_0, g_1, \dots, g_{n-2}) \\ \sigma_k (g_0, \dots, g_{n-1}) &= (g_0, g_1, \dots, g_{k-1}, 1, \sigma_k g_{k}, \dots, \sigma_k g_{n-1}). \end{aligned} A quick computation shows that this indeed produces a simplicial principal fiber bundle with fiber G.
